What were the actual results from any blood tests that have been done?  Don't accept from your doc that it was "normal".  That is the most overused word in the thyroid world.  You need to get a copy of the results from your doctor and evaluate them yourself, with maybe a little help from forum members, to see if they ran the right tests and where the results fall within their very broad ranges.  I also suggest that you check your temperature several times a day for several days and compare the average to the optimal of 98.6.  Temperatures below that level are an indication of low metabolism/ low thyroid.  By the way, I ran across some info awhile back that indicated that edema can be the result of long term untreated hypothyroidism.

question: I watch the TV show "Mystery Diagnones" and hope they will find my solution.  I have always had irregualr menstral cycles, dry thin hair, weak nails, and depression.  I tried to conceive about 10 years ago and had no response to fertility meds.  The only thing they could ever find wrong was a very low level of prolactin and progesterone.  I accepted my childless fate, but started mental heath meds (resperdal and lexapro) to combat my depression.  One of the side effects of risperdal is increase in prolactin so amazingly my prolactin is back to normal, but I am still the poster child for irregular periods.  I have had my thyroid tested dozens of times with normal results but a resent trip to the hospital yeilded a boarderline low reading so I was placed on .05 of synthroid.  I have gained about 175 pounds in 4 years even though I eat very normal.  I have edema in EVERY part of my body and have no stamina for exercise.  I have had an MRI to rule out a patuitary tumor, an ekg to rule out pulimary disease etc, a sonogram to rule out poly-cystic syndrome, and I have seen a kidney specialist and do not have cushings (98% function to all organs and no protein spill).  I have been on max doses of lots of different diaretics, but they have NO affect on me.  I am always thirsty and drink lots of fluids but urinate only a few times a day.  I find it so hard to get arround that I am now unemployed, and uninsured, so have been unable to persue a diagnones.
